/imgs/product-composting-timeline.webp.title: Composting Timeline - Industrial Composting Process
/imgs/product-composting-timeline.webp.description: COMPOSTING TIMELINE infographic showing biodegradation process in industrial composting facility at optimal temperature and moisture. Features EN13432/ASTM D6400 CERTIFIED badge. Timeline: WEEK 1 - Compostable pouch with Achieve Pack branding placed in compost bin surrounded by organic matter (food scraps, leaves), initial microbial activity begins. MONTH 1 - Early breakdown, pouch edges fragmenting, microorganisms colonizing. MONTH 2 - Complete decomposition, fully integrated into compost. MONTH 3 - Partial decomposition, significantly degraded, accelerated microbial action. MONTH 4-5 - Advanced decomposition, mostly broken into organic fragments, integrated into developing humus. Rich dark soil with earthworms shown as final result, ready for nutrient-rich soil application.
/imgs/product-composting-timeline.webp.alt: Composting timeline infographic showing 5-month biodegradation from compostable pouch to nutrient-rich soil with EN13432 ASTM D6400 certification

/imgs/blog/How/a_compostable_pouch_mater.title: Compostable Stand-Up Pouch Material Cross-Section Guide
/imgs/blog/How/a_compostable_pouch_mater.description: Technical cross-section diagram of compostable stand-up pouch material structure. Three-layer construction: 1) Plant-based PLA film (Inner layer, transparent) - Excellent moisture protection, plant-derived; 2) PBAT compostable polyester (Structural layer) - Oxygen Barrier & Structural Integrity, provides strength and oxygen barrier, fully compostable; 3) Kraft or white paper layer (Outer printed surface) - Light Protection & Printability, natural texture, printable surface, shields from light. Features: Compostable resealable zipper, Compostable one-way degassing valve. Overall Properties: Full barrier protection (Oxygen, Moisture, Light), compostable, printable, strong structure. Certifications: EN 13432 Certified Industrial Compostable, ASTM D6400 Certified Biodegradable & Compostable.
/imgs/blog/How/a_compostable_pouch_mater.alt: Compostable pouch 3-layer material cross-section diagram showing PLA PBAT kraft paper structure with EN13432 ASTM D6400 certifications

/imgs/blog/Sustainable-packaging/a_packa.title: Compostable vs Recyclable Packaging Decision Matrix
/imgs/blog/Sustainable-packaging/a_packa.description: Comprehensive decision matrix infographic comparing Compostable vs Recyclable packaging materials. LEFT SIDE - COMPOSTABLE: Industrial Composting path with PLA (Polylactic Acid - bio-based, transparent, rigid, requires commercial facilities), PBAT (Polybutylene Adipate Terephthalate - flexible, durable, home compostable, biodegradable), Cellulose (plant fiber derived, transparent, moisture barrier). Stats: 10-20% Premium for Compostable, 6-12 Months Degradation in industrial conditions. Certifications: EN13432, ASTM D6400. RIGHT SIDE - RECYCLABLE: Mechanical Recycling path with PE (Polyethylene) / PP (Polypropylene) - widely recycled, versatile, durable, HDPE and LDPE options. How2Recycle Store Drop-Off program. Stats: 30-55 Day Lead Time for International, Lower Cost & Widespread Infrastructure. CENTER - Decision Tree: What is your Product Type? What's your Timeline? What's your Budget? ULTIMATE GOAL: Reduce Environmental Impact Through Informed Choice and Circular Economy Principles.
/imgs/blog/Sustainable-packaging/a_packa.alt: Compostable vs recyclable packaging decision matrix with PLA PBAT cellulose PE PP comparison EN13432 ASTM D6400 How2Recycle certifications

Circular flow diagram with green arrows: 1) RAW MATERIALS - Renewable & Plant-Based Sources (kraft paper stack, bio-plastic pills with checkmark); 2) MANUFACTURING - Low-Impact Production, Energy Efficient (factory with gear/lightning icons); 3) SUSTAINABLE POUCHES - Durable, Lightweight, Designed for Reuse (cosmetic bottles with FSSC 22000 Certified, FDA Approved Material, OK Compost Home badges); 4) CONSUMER USE - Enjoy & Refill, Reduce Waste (person using dropper product); 5) RECYCLING - Collection, Sorting & Reprocessing (recycling bin, conveyor, washing machine); 6) NEW PRODUCTS - Closed-Loop Creation, Circular Economy (recycled cosmetic containers with leaf sprout). Center text: CIRCULAR ECONOMY: REDUCE, REUSE, RECYCLE, REGENERATE. Green leaves decoration. Growth chart icons showing sustainability metrics.
/imgs/blog/Recyclable/a_recyclable_packa.alt: Circular economy infographic for recyclable cosmetic packaging showing raw materials manufacturing sustainable pouches consumer use recycling new products cycle
